did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection primarily concerns itself with the issue of migrant workers and their plight as they cross the US-Mexico border. Most of the material is in VHS or DVD format comprised of segments of news programming from various broadcast television and cable programs.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Notes on Use of Collection
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Robin Hoover Papers (MS 468). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Reverend Robin (Robert Lane) Hoover, Ph.D. is a native of Big Spring, Texas. It was in Texas that Hoover attended Texas Christian University where he earned a Bachelor’s in Journalism and Religion. He went on to earn a Masters of Divinity Degree with an emphasis in social ethics from Brite Divinity School of Texas Christian University. Texas Tech University awarded Robin Hoover a Ph.D. in Political Science in 1998. Since 1980, Hoover has served continuously as a full time pastor in Disciples Congregations. Active in providing services to migrant people, Hoover has distinguished himself as a leader and a visionary. It was in Tucson, Arizona that Hoover founded and served as the inaugural president of Humane Borders, Inc., a social welfare corporation providing humanitarian assistance to migrants risking their lives crossing the Mexico-US border in Arizona. Hoover advocates major changes in US immigration/migration policies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into five series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of this collection is from 2000-2005 and focuses on the organization, Humane Borders, Inc., that Robin Hoover founded. The collection is mainly VHS and DVD copies of broadcasts from local and national news programs discussing migrant workers, immigration reform and the Humane Borders organization. These segments and programs concern themselves exclusively with issues related to immigration. Also included are a scattering of newspaper articles on the same subjects. A collection of plaques, awards and personal calendars is also included. The collection includes Robin Hoover’s dissertation from Texas Tech University as well as drafts and materials compiled while writing the dissertation, including notes and audio tapes of interviews with subjects relating to the topic of the dissertation. This collection is mainly concerned with the issue of immigration from Mexico to the United States along the Southern Arizona border.

This series consists of material published by Robin Hoover. It is arranged alphabetically, then chronologically. It contains audio cassettes, computer disks, drafts of works, newspaper articles and a copy of Hoover’s dissertation.
This series contains newspaper articles and other publications; such as workbooks, phone directories and reports.
This series consists of a few photographs pertaining to the Humane Borders organization and pocket calendars spanning three decades. One oversize image is located in Box 6.

This series contains mostly awards and plaques. Also included are examples of the water station flags from a water stations that Humane Borders maintains. Box 5 in this series contains oversize material.

did.unittitle: Leo B. Hart Humanitarian Award, undated

El Gobierno del Estado de Sonora, August 31, 2009

scopecontent.p: This series is comprised heavily of VHS and DVD copies of news broadcasts. The majority of VHS tapes have DVD copies. And while not every DVD has a VHS copy, many do. There is also one CD and one audiocassette tape, which have been marked.
